newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Taiwanese man arrested in Philippine drugs haul.
newsitem.headline: Taiwanese man arrested in Philippine drugs haul.

text.p: Police have arrested a Taiwanese man and confiscated 200 kg (441 lbs) of morphine and metamphetamine stimulants worth $30 million in one of the biggest seizures of illegal drugs in the Philippines, officials said on Wednesday.

The unidentified Taiwanese man was alone in a house in Tagaytay City in Cavite province, just south of Manila, when anti-narcotics agents raided the place on Tuesday evening, Cavite Governor Epimaco Velasco told reporters.
Velasco estimated the drugs to have a street value of 800 million pesos ($30 million).
He said the drugs were contained in about 200 sacks.
